PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_DiscreteAccessoryTypeInsulator
PropertySetDef.Definition: Properties of an insulator. The property set can be used by the predefined type INSULATOR of IfcDiscreteAccessory.

PropertyDef.Name: RatedCurrent
PropertyDef.Definition: The current that a device is designed to handle.

PropertyDef.Name: RatedVoltage
PropertyDef.Definition: The range of allowed voltage that a device is certified to handle. The upper bound of this value is the maximum.

PropertyDef.Name: InsulationVoltage
PropertyDef.Definition:
The insulation voltage.
The max voltage for normal insulation operation.

PropertyDef.Name: BreakdownVoltageTolerance
PropertyDef.Definition: Nominal value of the spark gap breakdown voltage tolerance.

PropertyDef.Name: OperationalTemperatureRange
PropertyDef.Definition: The temperature range in which the device operates normally.

PropertyDef.Name: CreepageDistance
PropertyDef.Definition: Shortest distance or the sum of the shortest distances along the surface on an insulator between two conductive parts which normally have the operating voltage between them. (IEV ref 471-01-04)

PropertyDef.Name: InstallationMethod
PropertyDef.Definition: Method of installation of cable/conductor. Installation methods are typically defined by reference in standards such as IEC 60364-5-52, table 52A-1 or BS7671 Appendix 4 Table 4A1 etc. Selection of the value to be used should be determined from such a standard according to local usage.

PropertyDef.Name: LightningPeakVoltage
PropertyDef.Definition: The peak lightning voltage that the insulator could withstand.

PropertyDef.Name: RMSWithstandVoltage
PropertyDef.Definition: Rms value of sinusoidal power frequency voltage that the insulation of the given equipment can withstand during tests made under specified conditions and for a specified duration. (IEV ref 614-03-22ï¼‰

PropertyDef.Name: Voltage
PropertyDef.Definition: The actual voltage and operable range.
